patterns: Which eqauation I can use to calculate the present value of one future value?

responses:
pv(perpetuity) can be viewd as:
Step 1: pv(1st cash floww) + pv(2nd cash flow) + pv(3rd cash flow) + ...
 Step2: apply the formula of S=a/(1+q) where q=1/(1+R)
Step 3:pv(perpetuity)=1/(1+R)/(1-1/(1+R)
 Step4: pv=1/(1+R-1)=C/R

patterns: what is the logic behind pv(annuity)
responses:
pv(annuity) can be viewed as the combination of 2 pv(perpetuity):
 Step 1: assume that we will receive $500 for the next 10 years
 Step 2: it is equvalent to receiving $500 forever, plus paying $500 forever starting year 11 
 Step 3:pv(1st perpetuity) + pv(2nd perpetuity) 
 Step 4: C/R (at 0) - C/R (at n)
 Step 5: C/R - C/R *(1- 1/(1+R)^n= C/R*(1-1/(1+R)^n)
